dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4100 IH: Foundation of the Federal Bar Association Charter Amendments Act of 2017
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Chabot introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 36, United States Code, to revise the Federal charter for the Foundation of the Federal Bar Association.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Foundation of the Federal Bar Association Charter Amendments Act of 2017.
Section 70501 of title 36, United States Code, is amended by striking subsection (b) and redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (b).
Section 70503 of title 36, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsections (a) and (b) and inserting the following:

subsection.text: Except as provided in this chapter, eligibility for membership in the corporation and the rights and privileges of members are as provided in the bylaws.

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (b); and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The terms of membership may not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, or national origin.

section.text: Section 70504 of title 36, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

subsection.text: The board of directors is the governing body of the corporation. The board may exercise, or provide for the exercise of, the powers of the corporation. The board of directors and the responsibilities of the board are as provided in the bylaws.
The officers and the election of the officers are as provided for in the bylaws.
The requirements for serving as a director or officer may not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, or national origin.

section.text: Section 70507 of title 36, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

subsection.text: The corporation may not issue stock or declare or pay a dividend.
The corporation or a director or officer in his or her corporate capacity may not contribute to, support, or participate in any political activity or in any manner attempt to influence legislation.

The income or assets of the corporation may not inure to the benefit of, or be distributed to, a director, officer, or member during the life of the charter granted by this chapter. This subsection does not prevent the payment, in amounts approved by the board of directors, of—

paragraph.text: reimbursement for expenses incurred in undertaking the corporation’s business, to officers, directors, or members.

subsection.continuation-text: This subsection does not prevent the award of a grant to a Federal Bar Association chapter of which an officer, director, member may be a member. This subsection also does not prevent the payment of reasonable compensation to the corporation’s employees for services undertaken on behalf of the corporation.

subsection.text: The corporation may not make a loan to a director, officer, member, or employee.
Members and private individuals are not liable for the obligations of the corporation.

subsection.header: Claim of governmental approval or authority
subsection.text: The corporation may not claim congressional approval or the authority of the United States Government for any of its activities; it may, however, acknowledge this charter.

section.text: Section 70508 of title 36, United States Code, is amended by striking the District of Columbia, and inserting a United States location decided by the board of directors and specified in the bylaws,.
Section 70510 of title 36, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:
The corporation shall comply with the law on service of process of the State or District in which it is incorporated.

section.header: Deposit of assets on dissolution or final liquidation
section.text: Section 70512 of title 36, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

section.header: Deposit of assets on dissolution or final liquidation
section.text: On dissolution or final liquidation of the corporation, any assets of the corporation remaining after the discharge of all liabilities shall be distributed as provided by the board of directors, but in compliance with the charter and bylaws.
